exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that returns the string "Hello, World!".

exercises.title: Sum of Two Numbers
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that takes two numbers as parameters and returns their sum.
exercises.outputDescription: The sum of a and b.

exercises.title: Check Even or Odd
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that takes a number and returns "Even" if it's even, "Odd" if it's odd.

exercises.title: Reverse a String
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that takes a string and returns it reversed.

exercises.title: Find Largest in Array
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that takes an array of numbers and returns the largest number.
exercises.outputDescription: The largest integer in the array.

exercises.title: Palindrome Checker
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that checks if a given string is a palindrome (reads the same forwards and backwards).
exercises.outputDescription: Boolean true if palindrome, false otherwise.

exercises.title: Fibonacci Sequence
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that generates the first n numbers in the Fibonacci sequence.
exercises.outputDescription: An array containing the first n Fibonacci numbers.

exercises.title: Deep Clone Object
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that creates a deep clone of a nested object.
exercises.outputDescription: A deep cloned copy of the object.

exercises.title: Debounce Function
exercises.problemStatement: Implement a debounce function that delays the execution of a function until after a specified time has elapsed since the last time it was invoked.
exercises.inputDescription: A function func and delay time in milliseconds.
exercises.outputDescription: A debounced version of the function.

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a program that prints "Hello, World!" to the console.

exercises.title: Calculate Area of Circle
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that calculates the area of a circle given its radius. Use Ï€ = 3.14159.

exercises.title: List Comprehension
exercises.problemStatement: Create a list of squares of numbers from 1 to n using list comprehension.

exercises.title: Count Vowels
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that counts the number of vowels (a, e, i, o, u) in a given string.

exercises.title: Prime Number Checker
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that checks if a given number is prime.
exercises.outputDescription: Boolean True if prime, False otherwise.

exercises.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function that merges two sorted lists into one sorted list.
exercises.inputDescription: Two sorted lists list1 and list2.
exercises.outputDescription: A single merged and sorted list.

exercises.title: Binary Search
exercises.problemStatement: Implement binary search algorithm to find the index of a target value in a sorted array.
exercises.inputDescription: A sorted list arr and a target value.
exercises.outputDescription: Index of target if found, -1 otherwise.

exercises.title: Class Inheritance
exercises.problemStatement: Create a base class Animal with method speak(), and derived classes Dog and Cat that override speak() with their own sounds.
exercises.outputDescription: Demonstrate polymorphism with different animal sounds.

exercises.title: Decorator Function
exercises.problemStatement: Create a decorator that measures the execution time of a function.

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a Java program that prints "Hello, World!" to the console.

exercises.title: Sum of Array Elements
exercises.problemStatement: Write a method that calculates the sum of all elements in an integer array.

exercises.title: String Manipulation
exercises.problemStatement: Write a method that converts a string to uppercase and removes all spaces.
exercises.outputDescription: Modified string without spaces and in uppercase.

exercises.title: Find Duplicates in Array
exercises.problemStatement: Write a method that finds all duplicate elements in an array and returns them as a list.

exercises.title: Implement Stack
exercises.problemStatement: Implement a Stack data structure with push, pop, peek, and isEmpty methods.

exercises.title: Binary Tree Traversal
exercises.problemStatement: Implement inorder, preorder, and postorder traversal for a binary tree.

exercises.title: Thread Synchronization
exercises.problemStatement: Create a multi-threaded program that safely increments a shared counter using synchronization.

exercises.title: Generic Class Implementation
exercises.problemStatement: Create a generic Pair<T, U> class that can hold two values of different types with getters and setters.

exercises.title: Design Pattern: Singleton
exercises.problemStatement: Implement the Singleton design pattern with thread-safe lazy initialization.

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a C++ program that outputs "Hello, World!" to the console.

exercises.title: Pointer Basics
exercises.problemStatement: Write a function to swap two numbers using pointers.
exercises.outputDescription: Swapped values of a and b.

exercises.title: STL Vectors
exercises.problemStatement: Use STL vector to store integers, sort them, and remove duplicates.

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a C# program that prints "Hello, World!" to the console.

exercises.title: LINQ Query
exercises.problemStatement: Use LINQ to filter a list of integers and return only even numbers.
exercises.outputDescription: A new list containing only even numbers.

exercises.title: Async/Await
exercises.problemStatement: Create an async method that simulates fetching data with a delay.

exercises.title: Type Annotations
exercises.problemStatement: Create a function with proper type annotations that adds two numbers.

exercises.title: Generic Function
exercises.problemStatement: Create a generic function that returns the first element of an array of any type.
exercises.outputDescription: First element with correct type inference.

exercises.title: Type Guards
exercises.problemStatement: Create a type guard function that checks if an object is of type Dog or Cat.

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a PHP script that outputs "Hello, World!".

exercises.title: Array Functions
exercises.problemStatement: Use array functions to filter, map, and reduce an array of numbers.

exercises.title: RESTful API
exercises.problemStatement: Create a RESTful API endpoint with proper HTTP methods and JSON responses.
exercises.outputDescription: JSON responses with proper status codes.

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a Ruby program that prints "Hello, World!".

exercises.title: Blocks and Iterators
exercises.problemStatement: Use the each method with a block to iterate over an array.

exercises.title: Metaprogramming
exercises.problemStatement: Use define_method to dynamically create getter and setter methods.

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a Go program that prints "Hello, World!".

exercises.title: Goroutines
exercises.problemStatement: Create multiple goroutines that execute concurrently.

exercises.title: Channels
exercises.problemStatement: Use channels to communicate between goroutines.

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a Rust program that prints "Hello, World!".

exercises.title: Ownership
exercises.problemStatement: Demonstrate ownership rules by moving and borrowing values.

exercises.title: Lifetimes
exercises.problemStatement: Use lifetime annotations to ensure references are valid.
exercises.sampleInput: fn longest<'a>(x: &'a str, y: &'a str) -> &'a str

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a Swift program that prints "Hello, World!".

exercises.title: Optionals
exercises.problemStatement: Demonstrate optional binding and nil coalescing with optional values.

exercises.title: Protocols
exercises.problemStatement: Define a protocol and implement it in multiple types.

exercises.title: Hello World
exercises.problemStatement: Write a Kotlin program that prints "Hello, World!".

exercises.title: Null Safety
exercises.problemStatement: Demonstrate nullable and non-nullable types with safe calls.

exercises.title: Coroutines
exercises.problemStatement: Use Kotlin coroutines for asynchronous programming.
